intro: Galium ossirwaense var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth woodypod, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
